alert.note: Alert for Harney County; Malheur County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 11 at 1:34PM PST until January 13 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Boise
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM MST /10 PM PST/ THIS EVENING TO 11 PM MST /10 PM PST/ SATURDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 10 inches with 10 to 20 inches across the mountains. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph with gusts to 55 mph across the mountains through Friday afternoon. * WHERE...Harney County and Malheur County zones. * WHEN...From 11 PM MST /10 PM PST/ this evening to 11 PM MST /10 PM PST/ Saturday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility and create whiteout conditions. Strong winds could cause damage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Blowing snow will reduce visibility and cover roads quickly tonight and Friday. Winds will decrease with snow increasing Friday night and Saturday. Those with travel plans this weekend should pay close attention to the forecast and consider not traveling if possible.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
